Posts.Content: renny85 wrote: Hi everyone! I am so worried about my sister who is 27 years old. About 2 years ago, she has a grape size lump at the 1 o'clock position on her left breast. She told me she went to the doctor and he said it was benign. About a month ago, my aunt noticed a hard lump more like a hard area at the 12 o'clock position on her left breast. I bought her health insurance and made an appointment at the UCLA breast center. The surgeon said she is more worries about the hard area at the 12 o'clock position compared to the small lump that has been there for 2 years. She ordered an ultrasound and mammogram and eventually a core biopsy guided by mammogram of the small lump. The ultrasound and mammogram both showed oly the small lump and not the hardened area. The radiologist seemed to think that the hard area is part of the breast tissue. The biopsy result of the small lump showed that it is fibroadenoma which is a huge relieve for us. It is about 3 weeks after the biopsy and the hard area seemed harder and the right side of her breast seemed to have a hard area too but not as big as her left. The surgeon wanted to do a open surgery biopsy of the large area but at that time my sister's left breast is still swollen because of the biopsy so we decided to wait a little. Is it something to be worried about when both the ultrasound and mammogram showed nothing at all on the large area? Is it considered fibrocystic codition? I am so so scared right now. Please share your thoughts. Thank you. God Bless everyone! Log in to post a reply
